result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob W Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Not eligible for release to extended supervision.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.

AMENDED 6/27/16:  RESTITUTION AMOUNT SET  
AMENDED 7/1/16:  RESTITUTION AMOUNT CORRECTED

Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: Ct. 1

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.

Defendant Jacob W Rogers in court with attorney Adrienne Moore and Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Jacob W Rogers in custody.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  State stipulates that all payments and statements forwarded to the court previously and are entailed in Exhibit 1 are due and owing to the victims family.  Defense requests that the Court take Judicial notice of the PSI whereas the victims father had a life insurance policy on the victim that paid the funeral expenses in full.  Defense argues fair and resonable - #2, #17, #20, #8 for a total of approx. $4,000 in disputed items.  Defense believes $17,972.95 is appropriate and could come out of his account at the prison at the rate of 10%.  BTC:  All expenses are resonable and necessary for the funeral.  The defendant is ordered to pay the full funeral amount.  The defendants ability to pay while serving a life sentence is reasonable and defendant is ordered to pay out of any account that he has.  Exhibit 1 is received.

Attorney Helmi Hamad and Adrienne Moore in court.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
